notes: Most destructive hurricane in modern Puerto Rico history. Massive migration spike to mainland.
mainland_destinations: Florida, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut, Massachusetts

notes: Hit just before Maria. Primarily affected northern coast.
Caused island-wide power outage. Significant flooding.
Major damage across the island. Significant migration impact.
Severe damage to infrastructure and agriculture.
Beginning of economic recession. Peak unemployment in 2010-2012. Debt crisis 2014-2016.
Debt default, austerity measures, government services cut. Accelerated migration.
Series of earthquakes in January 2020, largest M6.4. Power outages.
